answer.body: P1 Orientation Day has been tentatively scheduled on 16 November 2023 (Thursday). More details will be shared nearer the date.

questionListItems.title: When will the first day of school be in 2024?

answer.body: The tentative start date is Tuesday, 2 January 2024.

questionListItems.title: Is there a school-based Student Care Centre (SCC) in New Town Primary School?

answer.body: Yes. The school has a Student Care Centre. Currently the Student Care Centre is run by Commit Learning Schoolhouse Pte Ltd.

questionListItems.title: Can a student change CCA if they find their current selection unsuitable for them?

answer.body: As there may be various reasons why a student may find their current CCA unsuitable, the student can raise their request to their CCA teacher to explore feasible solutions. Parents can also write in to our SH/PE & CCA Ms Loh at loh_yan_ping@schools.gov.sg on CCA enquiries.

questionListItems.title: Does the school have any Open House.

answer.body:
New Town Primary School held its inaugural New Town Fiesta on 26 May earlier this year and will not be holding another Open House for 2023.
You may find information via our e-Open House microsite at https://www.newtownpri.moe.edu.sg/about-us/eopen-house/.

questionListItems.title:
My child is not a Singapore Citizen or Singapore PR. How can my child seek
admission to Primary 1?

answer.body: International students (IS) can only register for P1 during Phase 3 of the P1 Registration Exercise. Further information is available at this website https://www.moe.gov.sg/primary/p1-registration/international-students

questionListItems.title: Can I register in-person at the school?

answer.body:
MOE will only accept online registrations stipulated for the phases. If you are unable to register online, please contact your school of choice via telephone or email for assistance.

Email: ntps@moe.edu.sg

Tel: 6474 8805

questionListItems.title: Is my child eligible to register in New Town Primary School under Phase 2A?

answer.body: Your child is eligible to register in New Town Primary School under Phase 2A if you or another child of yours have previously studied in New Town Primary School or Ghim Moh Primary School. You can refer to this website https://www.moe.gov.sg/primary/p1-registration for more information.

questionListItems.title: What are the school hours? What is the reporting and dismissal time?

answer.body: Students need to report by 7.30 am. School dismissal is at 1.40 pm on Mondays, Tuesdays, Thursdays and Fridays, and 2.10 pm on Wednesdays.

questionListItems.title: How many students are there in a P1 class?

answer.body: Class sizes are capped at 30 students for P1 (and P2) classes.

questionListItems.title: Is there Financial Assistance Scheme (FAS) in this school? How do I apply?

answer.body: Yes, Financial Assistance Scheme (FAS) is available. Completed application form and supporting documents should be submitted to the admin team in the school. More details will be shared during P1 Orientation.

questionListItems.title: How many recess breaks are there for the students?

answer.body: There is one recess break for P1 students and at least one snack break.

questionListItems.title: What does the Primary 1 curriculum look like?

answer.body: You can refer to this website https://www.moe.gov.sg/primary/curriculum/syllabus for details of the P1 curriculum.

questionListItems.title: How does the school encourage students to read?

answer.body:
The English and Mother Tongue Language teachers bring students to the library as part of the school‚Äôs effort to inculcate a love for reading.

To further instill the habit of reading, the English Language department implements a class- based reading programme where English teachers and students share about the books they have read. Each class also has a book box with a wide selection of books for students to borrow.

questionListItems.title: Are there any enrichment classes for the P1 students?

answer.body:
Enrichment modules, which take place on Wednesdays during curriculum time, have been specially curated for our lower primary students.
Our two-year enrichment programme aims to develop our lower primary students to be Lively, Eloquent, Assured, Positive & ready to Soar (New Town L.E.A.P.S.!).
Some of the modules offered include Coding, Speech and Drama and 7 Habits - ‚ÄòLeader in Me‚Äô.
